standard_pricing_packages.note: Prices are per eye. Physician and Facility fees are separate.

options.name: Option 1: Light Adjustable Lens
options.description: Premium lens adjustable after surgery using UV light.

options.name: Option 2: Presbyopic Package with Astigmatism Correction Laser
options.description: Multifocal/EDOF lens for near and far vision.

options.name: Option 3: Single Vision Toric Package with Astigmatism Correction Laser
options.description: Toric IOL to correct astigmatism for distance vision.

fees.note: Fees typically fall between Option 1 and Option 4. Refer to internal billing sheet.

options.name: Option 4: Low Astigmatism Correction Laser Package
options.description: LRI or laser correction for minor astigmatism.

options.name: Option 5: Standard Surgery
options.description: Basic Monofocal IOL. Billed to insurance.

legal_policies.payment_policy: Three separate payments (Physician, Facility, Co-management) due before surgery.

pre_op_checklist: Start prescribed eye drops 3 days before surgery
Stop wearing contact lenses 1 week prior (soft) or 2 weeks (hard)
Arrange for a driver (you cannot drive yourself home)
Do not eat or drink anything after midnight the night before surgery
Bring your ID, insurance card, and signed consent forms

surgery_day_timeline.description: Check-in at front desk 1 hour before scheduled time
Nurses prep eye, administer dilating drops and mild sedative
Rest in recovery area for 30 minutes with snacks/juice
Review post-op instructions and go home with driver

post_op_checklist: Wear eye shield while sleeping for the first week
Use antibiotic and anti-inflammatory drops as per schedule
Do NOT rub or press on the eye
Avoid bending at the waist or heavy lifting (>10 lbs)
Keep water/soap out of eye when showering
Attend follow-up appointment (usually 1 day after surgery)
